question: 外来語
sourceMnemonic: You know the word <ja>外来</ja> to mean "imported." So, combine that with the kanji for <kanji>language</kanji> and you have an imported word, aka a <vocabulary>borrowed word</vocabulary>. There are a lot of these in Japanese, which makes this word important. Almost everything in katakana is a <ja>外来語</ja>, in fact.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
